Description: Neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora; interior: glazed above and reserved below; exterior: part of black band at top; below, incised lotus and palmette chain with double row of linking circles; added red on hearts of palmettes and on kalyxes of lotuses.
Curator's comments: For double rows of linking circles, compare side A of the amphora by Exekias in the Vatican Museum. Beazley, J. D., The Development of Attic Black-Figure. Berkley 1986, 2nd edition, pl. 64.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 213, no. B39)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0035) (Phase 1)
